title: [Neuroscience] Brains can be hotter than the rest of our bodies, especially in women: Healthy human brains can sometimes register temperatures of 40.9 °C – a couple of degrees higher than the rest of the body – with the highest temperatures associated with the second half of the menstrual cycle

[Epidemiology] Phylogenomic characterization and signs of microevolution in the 2022 multi-country outbreak of monkeypox virus: current monkeypox outbreak in nonendemic countries likely came from virus that caused 2018 Nigerian outbreak and has far more mutations than expected, several that increase transmission
